title: Riot, the bot lane needs you.
body:
Knight's vow and redemption are very cool, very fun items. But added to what the supports already have, it's not enough.
For the longest time I was okay with marksmen underperforming. Till about 2-3 items in, your marksmen can barely even take the scuttle crab.
I do feel like the rest of the game has moved forward and left the bot lane behind though.

I use to play normals a lot with my friends, but it was honestly the nature of 'ganking' that has turned me onto ARAMs exclusively.
I'm just so sick of feeling that the entire reason my adc and I are in lane, is so the Rengars, Leblancs, Katarinas, Zeds, Fizzs, junglers and top laners have something to get fed on.

I'm not saying "adc's need more damage" or that supports are useless, it just feels like the game isn't really balanced around botlane at all.

I get that burst mages are supposed to counter marksmen, but when Syndra can just walk into botlane, and force a support and their marksmen to walk under tower, regardless of the wave.... That's a pretty lame feeling.

It isn't just burst mages either, on the other hand we have assassins, granted they are basically just the ad equivalent of burst mages, but they both bring misery to the bot lane.

Then, we also have the premier junglers, which more often than not can just steamroll any squishy target they want.

Kiting mechanics and 2 second crowd control isn't enough. 75% base mana regen isn't enough. 3 gold per 10 isn't enough.

Why should the people who go to the bot lane, have to put twice the effort into staying even, as burst mages and assassins have to put in to get fed?

You can do everything right, you can get ahead in lane, deny the assassins their gold.... and get four man ganked under tower.

There aren't enough arcane shifts in the world.

replies.body:
I myself am an ADC main and I can very much feel the pain that you are when it comes to playing ADC at the moment, however after a lot of thinking about it over the past few months, I think that the position ADC is in actually makes a lot of sense when you think about it.

How I have come to this conclusion and how I hope to explain this is we first need to not look at ADC as a role, but ADC as ITS role in the team. Let me explain a bit more on this, when we think about ADC and its role in a team we think of high amounts of damage over an extended period of time. Like to the point where its not uncommon for them to be doing majority of the damage over an extended team fight. On the other end though pros must come with cons and that con is how squishy they are, how if caught out or not protected by their team how easily they can be killed.

Now in the example you gave you said that why should a Syndra be allowed to walk up and kill you, or if she roamed bot lane why is she able to make you back away to your tower. Well in a sense that is the PRO of an mid laner. Packing high burst with long cooldowns. They are able to do that because they were designed to do that. Going back to the theme of with pros there must be cons, notice how I noted on long cooldowns. Most, if not all mid laners that I can think of at the moment in my head need these cooldowns to be up to do damage. So in the sense of a team fight if your front line is able to force the enemy mid laner to use their cooldowns on the tanks, instead of the ADCs, there we have the con of the mid laners. They have to pick how they want to use their cooldowns to disrupt the enemy team.

When it comes down to it league of legends is a team game, sometimes its hard to think of it that way in  the heat of solo queue xD but it very much is. Each person fills a role in each team and its your job to fill that role. As an ADC its your role to be doing all the damage that you can as safely as you can. With your support sometimes it can be their job to protect you, or they could be a diver with CC such as Leona and instead be more aggressive and set you up kills. ADC is a very difficult role to play in solo queue with this in mind because you in a sense have a very big con that can be taken advantage of easily. This is where we roll into how its difficult to balance the game around the different elos where people understand their roles and people who are still learning, the competitive players and all that fun stuff that I applaud Riot for doing so well at. 

If you are interested Riot actually did a panel at PAX Aus this year where they went in depth into balancing champions in what they called "Riot Games' Top 5 Pain in the Ass Champions to Balance" It was a very fun panel that I was lucky enough to attend and ask a question at that really gave an indepth look as to how they balance the game and I would defs recommend having a watch if you are interested in learning more. (Rengar is also one of the 5 champions featured as well.) [If you want a link to the vod you can find it here.](https://www.twitch.tv/pax2/v/100188744)

--

I hope that helps explain a bit as to my thoughts as to the current state of ADC. If you want to chime in your thoughts on what I said go for it, and if there is any other questions I can answer specifically let me know as well. Good luck in your games and I will see you around!

~Elam
I thank you for your comment, and I'll do my best to adapt to the ever shifting state of the game :)

>
> I'm not saying "adc's need more damage" or that supports are useless, it just feels like the game isn't really balanced around botlane at all.

Because it shouldn't in the first place?

What gives the reasons why there has to always be an ADC and a Support in bot lane, and balance the game itself around it too?

Now I really doubt it, but if for some reason Riot is finally leaving their hands in forcibly manipulating the meta instead of letting it grow on their own, that'd be great, it'd be awesome. But I doubt it. And I also doubt that there is a "not enough attention" issue in the bot lane, since that bot literally has been the entire focus of the game's balance for most of seasons in the game's entire history already. Almost any and everything has been buffed and nerfed on the basis of how well they're doing with and against ADCs, for a good while now, if you haven't caught up yet.

So no, I don't think bot needs Riot at all. In fact it's really about time we need less of Riot in bot.

Perhaps less of Riot is truly in fact what the bot lane needs, maybe attention will get drawn somewhere else :P

I do thank you for your perspective on this issue though, it's nice to see a point of view that is so different from my own.

I also remember a time when spell thieves edge received a nerf because mages started taking it mid. With that in mind, I can respect why it's hard to give supports much.
IMO the game has been utterly shit since the tank meta was introduced.

> [{quoted}](name=JesusForgotHisGA,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=23RRWQV1,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-01-01T17:23:41.066+0000)
>
> IMO the game has been utterly shit since the tank meta was introduced.

So since S2? Not to mention, none of the "tank meta" in later seasons even has come remotely close to the real tank-meta of the S2; or if you haven't caught up yet, there is none after S2 (or at least only for a very short period of time when Cinderhulk was arguably OP, but that still wasn't because that tanks were OP, it was just that 1 item). 

It's just that people for some reason got used to S3's assassins killing full tanks in a rotation and ADCs pew pew gunning down full tanks like minions, and thinking "now, _that_ is normal". And when tanks are no longer just utterly underpowered, "ZOMG TANK META!!11!!" 

And really, what's the fundamental difference between tank meta and any other meta? Aren't they all pretty bad, game-breaking, imbalanced and potentially obnoxious/toxic? But why are people cool with assassin meta and ADC meta that have been dominating the game for the vast majority of the last 5+ years and they get so little complaints, when tank meta that has barely made it over 1 year (and maybe a half) of the game's history gets so much hate?

I disagree, I think it was the "Juggernaut" meta that killed it ;_;.
or at least made it 100x harder

100% agreed
Bot lane is the least likeliest lane to carry a game

All you can do as bot is try and take first tower. (other team must misplay, also requires your jg to help as you will be vulnerable to ganks being so far up)

then rotate mid and top to get an early tower and drake advantage

but yeah adc and supports are the suckiest role in LOL at the moment

I cannot think of a single reason why jungle say with less gold and less items will gain more xp and destroy an adc 1 vs 1 till late game arrives.

i feel that as a support main, the only reason bot exists is to have 4 people bot lane dive two people bot lane in the first ten minutes, thats it. most supports get maybe 10k g per game, maybe, but are expected to perform just as well as the rest of the team, regardless of having 0 farm, and no items. 3 gold per ten seconds is not worth all the cs you miss, and all the exp you share. i fell support items should do what relic shield does and give full exp to the holder and the person that takes it.

Its one of the reasons support is considered "boring"
I take it as a challenge every game, not just trying to rely only on my items, but my positioning and play as well.

Adc is just stale, i mean how long has the spot been reserved for a glass cannon marksmen. Its the most rigid meta out of all 5 roles. You can't keep doing the same thing for 6 years while every other role evolves and expect the same outcome and same result.

Support on the other hand has come a long way and a good support can help carry a team without having to get 20 kills to do so.

SIX YEARS!

For Six years the game was all about ADCs.
The second that gets taken away all the ADCs either quit the game or bitch and moan.
And now they are getting their supports to bitch and moan for them.

All in all I'm glad that ADCs are in the shitter these days.
I hated every game being left to the ADC as the winner of the match.

I find it hilarious that Streamers/Youtubers who rose to fame by playing ADC quit the game because of the Marksman Update, and consequently lost viewers and subscribers.

For six years, top lane, jungle, support and occasionally mid lane were nothing in the eyes of the game's community.
All eyes were on the ADC mains, and their awesome plays.

I'm sorry Supports, unfortunately you guys have to suffer as ADC mains get what's coming to them and their egos.

I feel your pain, too often have I seen an enemy Cait run away with a game, dealing what seems an unfair amount of damage at next to no effort.
As I started playing midway through last year though, I guess I don't have a clear view of the full picture.

Thank you for your perspective.
